segment.source: How to Generate Reports
segment.target: How to Generate Reports

segment.source: How to Generate Reports
segment.target: How to Generate Reports

segment.source: How to Generate Reports
segment.target: How to Generate Reports

segment.source: The following report types can be created by administrators in MED-V:
segment.target: The following report types can be created by administrators in MED-V:

segment.source: Status—Use the status report to review the current status of all active users and all MED-V workspaces of each user based on a defined period of time.
segment.target: Status—Use the status report to review the current status of all active users and all MED-V workspaces of each user based on a defined period of time.

segment.source: This includes viewing computers that are currently connected to the server or, if they are not currently connected, the date and time they were last connected to the server, the status of each computer, and other relevant information.
segment.target: This includes viewing computers that are currently connected to the server or, if they are not currently connected, the date and time they were last connected to the server, the status of each computer, and other relevant information.

segment.source: Activity Log—Use this report to review events that originated from a specific host or user in a defined date range.
segment.target: Activity Log—Use this report to review events that originated from a specific host or user in a defined date range.

segment.source: Error Log—Use this report to view errors that originated from a specific host or user in a defined date range.
segment.target: Error Log—Use this report to view errors that originated from a specific host or user in a defined date range.

segment.source: The report results can be sorted by any column by clicking the appropriate column name.
segment.target: The report results can be sorted by any column by clicking the appropriate column name.

segment.source: The report results can be grouped by dragging a column header to the top of the report.
segment.target: The report results can be grouped by dragging a column header to the top of the report.

segment.source: Drag multiple column headers to group one column after another.
segment.target: Drag multiple column headers to group one column after another.

segment.source: How to Generate a Status Report
segment.target: How to Generate a Status Report

segment.source: To generate a status report
segment.target: To generate a status report

segment.source: Click the Reports management button.
segment.target: Click the Reports management button.

segment.source: In the Reports module, on the Report Types menu, select Status, and click Generate.
segment.target: In the Reports module, on the Report Types menu, select Status, and click Generate.

segment.source: The Report Parameters dialog box appears.
segment.target: The Report Parameters dialog box appears.

segment.source: In the Report Parameters dialog box, in the Number of days field, enter a number or use the arrows to select the number of days to include in the status report, and click OK.
segment.target: In the Report Parameters dialog box, in the Number of days field, enter a number or use the arrows to select the number of days to include in the status report, and click OK.

segment.source: A status report is generated.
segment.target: A status report is generated.

segment.source: The report parameters are defined in the following table.
segment.target: The report parameters are defined in the following table.

segment.source: Client MED-V Workspace Properties
segment.target: Client MED-V Workspace Properties

segment.source: Property
segment.target: Property

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Time
segment.target: Time

segment.source: The date and time the event occurred.
segment.target: The date and time the event occurred.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: By default, the events are displayed in descending date order.
segment.target: By default, the events are displayed in descending date order.

segment.source: However, it can be changed by clicking the Time Received column.
segment.target: However, it can be changed by clicking the Time Received column.

segment.source: User Name
segment.target: User Name

segment.source: The user who initiated the event.
segment.target: The user who initiated the event.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If the event occurred before a user logged on, the user name is SYSTEM.
segment.target: If the event occurred before a user logged on, the user name is SYSTEM.

segment.source: Host Name
segment.target: Host Name

segment.source: The name of the host computer.
segment.target: The name of the host computer.

segment.source: Workspace Name
segment.target: Workspace Name

segment.source: The name of the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: The name of the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: Workspace Computer Name
segment.target: Workspace Computer Name

segment.source: The name of the computer the MED-V workspace is running on.
segment.target: The name of the computer the MED-V workspace is running on.

segment.source: Online
segment.target: Online

segment.source: The current state of the client computer:
segment.target: The current state of the client computer:

segment.source: Stopped
segment.target: Stopped

segment.source: Started at date and time the workspace was started
segment.target: Started at date and time the workspace was started

segment.source: Client Version
segment.target: Client Version

segment.source: The version number of the client.
segment.target: The version number of the client.

segment.source: Policy Version
segment.target: Policy Version

segment.source: The policy version that the MED-V workspace is currently using.
segment.target: The policy version that the MED-V workspace is currently using.

segment.source: Image Name
segment.target: Image Name

segment.source: The name of the image.
segment.target: The name of the image.

segment.source: Image Version
segment.target: Image Version

segment.source: The image version that the MED-V workspace is currently using.
segment.target: The image version that the MED-V workspace is currently using.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: MED-V workspace version can be Unknown if it has not yet been downloaded onto a computer.
segment.target: MED-V workspace version can be Unknown if it has not yet been downloaded onto a computer.

segment.source: How to Generate an Activity Log Report
segment.target: How to Generate an Activity Log Report

segment.source: To generate an activity log report
segment.target: To generate an activity log report

segment.source: Click the Reports management button.
segment.target: Click the Reports management button.

segment.source: The Reports module appears.
segment.target: The Reports module appears.

segment.source: In the Reports module, on the Report Types menu, select Activity Log, and click Generate.
segment.target: In the Reports module, on the Report Types menu, select Activity Log, and click Generate.

segment.source: In the Report Parameters dialog box, configure one or more of the following parameters:
segment.target: In the Report Parameters dialog box, configure one or more of the following parameters:

segment.source: Number of days—The number of days to display in the report.
segment.target: Number of days—The number of days to display in the report.

segment.source: User name contains—Any event where the user name contains the text entered is included in the report.
segment.target: User name contains—Any event where the user name contains the text entered is included in the report.

segment.source: Host name contains—Any event where the host name contains the text entered is included in the report.
segment.target: Host name contains—Any event where the host name contains the text entered is included in the report.

segment.source: Click OK.
segment.target: Click OK.

segment.source: A report is generated with the events and dates selected.
segment.target: A report is generated with the events and dates selected.

segment.source: The report parameters are defined in the following table.
segment.target: The report parameters are defined in the following table.

segment.source: Activity Log Report Properties
segment.target: Activity Log Report Properties

segment.source: Property
segment.target: Property

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Event ID
segment.target: Event ID

segment.source: The event ID.
segment.target: The event ID.

segment.source: Severity
segment.target: Severity

segment.source: Information, Error, Warning
segment.target: Information, Error, Warning

segment.source: Category
segment.target: Category

segment.source: The module that the report is referring to.
segment.target: The module that the report is referring to.

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: A description of the event.
segment.target: A description of the event.

segment.source: Time Received
segment.target: Time Received

segment.source: The date and time the event was received on the server.
segment.target: The date and time the event was received on the server.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If the client is working offline, the server receives the reports when the client is online.
segment.target: If the client is working offline, the server receives the reports when the client is online.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: By default, the events are displayed in descending date order.
segment.target: By default, the events are displayed in descending date order.

segment.source: However, it can be changed by clicking the Time Received column.
segment.target: However, it can be changed by clicking the Time Received column.

segment.source: Client Time
segment.target: Client Time

segment.source: The date and time the event occurred according to the client clock.
segment.target: The date and time the event occurred according to the client clock.

segment.source: Host Name
segment.target: Host Name

segment.source: The name of the host computer.
segment.target: The name of the host computer.

segment.source: User Name
segment.target: User Name

segment.source: The user who initiated the event.
segment.target: The user who initiated the event.

segment.source: Workspace Name
segment.target: Workspace Name

segment.source: The name of the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: The name of the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: Workspace Computer Name
segment.target: Workspace Computer Name

segment.source: The name of the computer the MED-V workspace is running on.
segment.target: The name of the computer the MED-V workspace is running on.

segment.source: How to Generate an Error Log Report
segment.target: How to Generate an Error Log Report

segment.source: To generate an error log report
segment.target: To generate an error log report

segment.source: Click the Reports management button.
segment.target: Click the Reports management button.

segment.source: In the Reports module, on the Report Types menu, select Error Log, and click Generate.
segment.target: In the Reports module, on the Report Types menu, select Error Log, and click Generate.

segment.source: In the Report Parameters dialog box, configure one or more of the following parameters:
segment.target: In the Report Parameters dialog box, configure one or more of the following parameters:

segment.source: Number of days—The number of days to display in the report.
segment.target: Number of days—The number of days to display in the report.

segment.source: User name contains—Any event where the user name contains the text entered is included in the report.
segment.target: User name contains—Any event where the user name contains the text entered is included in the report.

segment.source: Host name contains—Any event where the host name contains the text entered is included in the report.
segment.target: Host name contains—Any event where the host name contains the text entered is included in the report.

segment.source: Click OK.
segment.target: Click OK.

segment.source: A report is generated with the events and dates selected.
segment.target: A report is generated with the events and dates selected.

segment.source: The report parameters are defined in the following table.
segment.target: The report parameters are defined in the following table.
